title: Stephen Dedalus' search for self-identity as seen from his conflicts in James Joyce's a portrait of the artist as a young man
abstract: This thesis concerns with Stephen Dedalus ? search for his self-identity which is seen from his conflicts,both internal and outer conflicts.In analyzing Stephen ?s search for his self-identity in James Joyce ?s A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man, the thesis writer divides the analysis into two parts In the first part,the thesis writer discusses Stephen?s search for his self-identity which is seen from his conflicts during his childhood In the second part,she discusses Stephen?s search for his self-identity which is seen from his conflicts during his adolescence.Finally,though not all of Stephen?s internal conflicts are resolved,the thesis writer comes to a conclusion that all of the conflicts show his search for self-identity.Though Stephen decides to leave his country,his family,his friends and his religion,he does not feel empty anymore in his soul as he has chosen to be an artist in his late adolescence.
contributors: SARDIUS KUNTJARA (Advisor 1); Josefa Juniarti Mardijono (Examination Committee 1)
subjects: JOYCE, JAMES AUGUSTINE, 1882-1941. A PORTRAIT OF THE ARTIST AS A YOUNG MAN-STUDY AND TEACHING; SCIENCE FICTION, ENGLISH-19TH CENTURY-STUDY AND TEACHING
